summary: mammarenaviruses are classified into two main groups, Old World (OW) and New World (NW). the OW Lassa virus (LASV), causative agent of Lassa fever (LF), is the most significant OW mammarenaviral pathogen. the most significant OW mammarenavirus is Junn virus (JUNV) a live attenuated vaccine strain of candid#1 is licensed in argentina. current anti-mammarenavirus therapy is limited to off-label use of the nucleoside analogue ribavirin that is only partially effective. such therapies include repurposing of already existing, FDA-approved drugs with strong safety profiles. mmarenavirus NP is a multifunctional protein that is involved in different steps of the virus life cycle. a primary role of NP is to encapsidate the viral genomic and antigenomic RNAs to form the nucleocapsid templates. NP counteracts the host-cell type I interferon (IFN-I) response to infection by blocking the activation of interferon regulatory factor 3 (IRF3) through the retinoic acid in ATPase Na+/K+ transporting subunit alpha 1 (ATP1A1) and prohibitin (PHB) were pro-viral factors. using RNA interference (RNAi)-mediated knock-down and pharmacological inhibitors of ATP1A1 and PHB reduced virus multiplication significantly. r3LCMV expressing a C-terminus Strep-tag version of enhanced green fluorescent protein (r3LCMV/eGFP-Strep) we rescued rLCMV/Strep-NP and r3LCMV/eGFP-Strep. we rescued rLCMV/Strep-NP and r3LCMV/eGFP-Strep cells. vero cells treated for 16 h with tissue cultured supernatants (TCS) treated with TCS from A549 cells infected with rLCMV/NP(D382A), a mutant unable to prevent induction of IFN-I [30], and subsequently with SeV, were fully susceptible to VSV-induced CPE. A549 cells were infected (MOI = 0.1) with the indicated rLCMV or mock-infected, and 36 h later infected with SeV. at 24 h pi with rVSV, cells were fixed with 4% PFA and stained with crystal violet to assess rVSV-induced cytopathic effect. polyacrylamide gel electrophoresis (SDS-PAGE) followed by SYPRO Ruby protein gel staining. protein complexes in the rest of eluates from the PD samples were concentrated by trichloroacetic acid (TCA) precipitation and subjected to trypsin digestion. protein complexes present in PD samples were separated by SDS-PAGE and visualized by SYPRO staining. some protein bands present only in the Strep-NP PD sample are indicated by asterisks. list of identified host-cell proteins found only in NP-strep pull down samples with at least five spectral counts. list of host-cell proteins found only in NP-strep pull down samples with at least five spectral counts. reader. rLCMV/Strep-NP and r3LCMV/eGFP-Strep Plasmid-mediated expression of viral genes in transfected cells has been used successfully to identify virus-host-cell protein-protein interactions. this approach has the potential problem that overexpression of a single viral gene product may potentiate PPI interactions that are not relevant during the course of a natural virus infection. the fitness of rLCMV/Strep-NP and r3LCMV/eGFP-Strep was modestly decreased compared to that observed with wild-type (rLCMV ARM) and Clone 13 strains of LCMV. both rLCMV/Strep-NP and r3LCMV/eGFP-Strep had WT-like growth kinetics and reached high titers. A549 cells (1,000 cells/well) in a 384-well plate were reverse transfected with siRNA pools targeting each indicated gene. at 72 h post-transfection, cells were fixed and stained with DAPI. a549 cells were reverse-transfected with siRNAs against ATP1A1 or with NC siRNA. 72 h later, cells were infected with rLCMV/ZsG. confocal microscopy examined the co-localization of NP with ATP1A1 and PHB in LCMV-infected cells. weighted co-localization coefficients were significantly higher than non-weighted CC, indicating the presence of brighter pixels in the co-localized regions. weighted CC were determined by taking into consideration the brightness of each channel signal. p values were determined by a two-tailed paired t test using GraphPad Prism software. ouabain had TIs of 4.99 (CC50 = 28.9 nM, IC50 = 5.79 nM [log108.237M]) and 3.81 (CC50 = 70.0 nM, IC50 = 18.4 nM) in A549 and Vero E6 cells. rocaglamide had TIs of >105 (CC50 > 1000 nM, IC50 = 9.51 nM) and 10.3 (CC50 = at 24 and 48 h pi, TCSs were collected, and virus titers were determined by IFFA. data represent means SD of results from three independent experiments. ATP1A1 and PHB are involved in different steps of the mammarenavirus life cycle. rocaglamide treatment resulted in a negligible number of eGFP+ cells. A549 cells seeded (2.5 x 105 cells/well) in a 12-well plate and cultured overnight were infected (moi = 0.1) with rLCMV/eGFP or remained uninfected (mock) eGFP expression in infected cells was examined by flow cytometry. at 24 h pi, cells were washed with fresh media to eliminate infectious virus particle produced in the absence of compound treatment. cells were cultured for another 24 h in fresh media in the presence of ouabain. GP-incorporation efficiency was estimated by dividing ZsGreen signal intensity in BHK-21 cell lysate by that in 293T cell lysate (1st). data represent means SD from three independent experiments. the effects of ouabain and rocaglamide on the late step of the arenavirus life cycle, Z-mediated budding. at 24 h post-transfection, we removed the tissue culture supernatant (TCS) and washed extensively transfected cells to eliminate already budded Z. treatment with ouabain caused a reduction in both LCMV and LASV Z budding efficiency. the second experiment involved infection (MOI = 0.1) of cells with LCMV. 48 h later we washed infected cells three times to remove extracellular infectious progeny produced during the first 48 h of infection. results from both experiments consistently showed that ouabain did not inhibit assembly de novo of extracellular infectious virus. at 48 h pi, cells were fixed and stained with DAPI. eGFP signal was normalized to DAPI signal. data represent % synergy at 95% confidence interval. ATP1A1 and PHB function as pro-viral factors of a range of mammarenaviruses. these findings indicate that ATP1A1 and PHB function as pro-viral factors of a range of mammarenaviruses. NP interactomes are important cell targets during natural mammarenavirus infections. but have low transfection efficiency. differences in experimental conditions and analysis methodologies used to generate the LCMV NP interactome documented by King et al. inhibitor-B kinase (NP-IKK) was identified as an NP-binding protein using plasmid-mediated overexpression in transfected cells [47] this discrepancy may have been caused by very low expression of IKK in LCMV-infected cells. NP-IKK interaction could be temporarily regulated and take place at early times pi. a low concentration of ouabain induces conformational change in ATP1A1. this results in activation and release of proto-oncogene tyrosine protein kinase, Src, from ATP1A1 followed by activation of downstream signaling that inhibits cell entry of murine hepatitis virus. rocaglamide inhibits protein synthesis by targeting eIF4A. kd expression via siRNA resulted in increased LCMV multiplication. MAP1B may have anti-LCMV activity. NS1 and NS2 of human respiratory syncytial virus antagonizes host IFN-I response by reducing levels of TNF receptor associated factor (TRAF3), IKK (NS1), and STAT2 (NS2) [65]. NS2-MAP1B interaction interfered with HRSV NS2’s ability to reduce levels of STAT2, whereas the role of NS1-MAP1B interaction remains to be determined. eronin-containing T-complex (CCT) were identified as prominent hits in our NP interactome. the mammalian CCT is critical for folding of many proteins with important functions in diverse cellular processes. members of the CCT have been implicated in multiplication of different viruses including rabies virus [76, 77], HCV [78] and FLUAV [79]. pro- and antiviral host-cell factors identified in this study in mammarenavirus multiplication will advance our understanding of the multiple functions of NP. drugs that are already approved can be repurposing as therapeutics to combat human pathogenic mammarenavirus infections. pol1S Cl-13 plasmids directed pol1-mediated intracellular synthesis of recombinant LCMV S genome RNA species coding for Strep-tagged NP or eGFP. rLCMV expressing eGFP (rLCMV/eGFP) was generated as described [85] and rLCMV expressing ZsGreen (rLCMV/ZsG) instead of eGFP was generated by reverse genetics. cells were fixed with 4% paraformaldehyde (PFA) in phosphate-buffered saline (PBS) cells were stained with a rat mAb to NP (VL-4, Bio X Cell, West Lebanon, NH) conjugated with Alexa Fluor 488 (VL-4-AF488, Protein Labeling Kit, Life Technologies, Carlsbad, CA) al antibodies to -tubulin (QIAGEN), eGFP (Takara Bio USA, Mountain View, CA), GP2 (We33/36), ATP1A1 (TehrmoFisher Scientific, Rockford, IL), PHB (Abcam, Cambridge, MA) or rabbit polyclonal antibodies to -tubulin (Cell Signaling Technologies, Danvers, MA) or glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate dehydrogen lysate was clarified by centrifugation at 3,900 x g at 4°C for 30 min. cell lysate was then incubated with strep-tactin sepharose resin (QIAGEN) at 4°C. after 2 h of incubation, the resin was washed three times with PD lysis buffer (+) and once with PD lysis buffer without TritonX-100 (PD lysis buffer [–]). MudPIT analysis An analytical reversed-phase liquid chromatography column was generated by pulling a 100-m (interior diameter (ID) of 360 m) OD capillary tube to 5-m ID tip. the column was further packed, washed, and equilibrated at 10 mPa. data analysis Protein and peptide identification were performed with Integrated Proteomics Pipeline—IP2. DTASelect parameters were—p 2 -y 1—trypstat—pfp.01 –extra-pI-DB-dm-in. the tandem mass spectra were searched against a human protein database. siRNA target host-cell proteins were selected based on availability of validated siRNA sequences. the siRNAs we used to examine the effects on LCMV multiplication of knockdown expression of NP-interacting host-cell protein candidate hits correspond to the genome-wide ON TARGET-Plus (OTP) human siRNA library (18,301 genes, 4 siRNAs/gene; Dharmacon, Lafayette, CO) DAPI signals were measured by a fluorescent plate reader (Synergy H4 Hybrid Multi-Mode Microplate Reader), BioTek, Winooski, VT. cells were incubated with primary mouse anti ATP1A1 or PHB antibody followed by secondary anti-mouse IgG antibody conjugated with Alexa Fluore 568. each pixel was assigned a value of 1. p values were determined by a two-tailed paired t test using GraphPad Prism software. IC50 determination A549 or Vero E6 cells seeded (2.0 x 104 cells/well) seeded in a 96-well plate and cultured overnight were treated with 3-fold serial compound dilutions at 37°C and 5% CO2 for 2 h. eGFP levels in clarified cell lysates adjusted to same total protein concentration with cell lysis buffer were measured by a fluorescent plate reader. eGFP levels in clarified cell lysates adjusted to same total protein concentration with cell lysis buffer were measured by a fluorescent plate reader. cells were cultured in fresh medium containing ouabain (30 or 40 nM) or rocaglamide (50 or 100 nM) and 24 h later, virion-like particle (VLP)-containing TCS. cells were resuspended in PBS, and Z expression in total cell lysate and TCS (containing VLPs) were analyzed by western blots. at 48 h pi, cells were three times washed with fresh media to eliminate infectious virus particle produced in the absence of compound treatment. at 48 h pi, cells were fixed, permeabilized by treatment with DB, and stained with DAPI. eGFP and DAPI signals were measured by a fluorescent plate reader. eGFP readouts were normalized by DAPI readouts. eGFP readouts were normalized by DAPI readouts. a two-tailed unpaired t test used GraphPad Prism software. pol1S Cl-13 plasmids directed pol1-mediated intracellular synthesis of recombinant LCMV S genome RNA species coding for Strep-tagged NP or eGFP. rLASV expressing eGFP (rLASV/eGFP) was generated by reverse genetics using similar procedures to generate rLCMVGPC/eGFP. cells were stained with a rat mAb to NP (VL-4, Bio X Cell, West Lebanon, NH) conjugated with Alexa Fluor 488 (VL-4-AF488, Protein Labeling Kit, Life Technologies, Carlsbad, CA) lysates were prepared in PD lysis buffer (+) and clarified by centrifugation at 21,130 x g at 4°C for 10 min. ATP1A1 (TehrmoFisher Scientific, Rockford, IL), PHB (Abcam, Cambridge, MA) or rabbit polyclonal antibodies to -tubulin or glyceraldehyde-3-phosphate dehydrogenase (GAPDH, Millipore) followed by incubation with appropriate horseradish peroxidase-conjugated anti-mouse or anti-rabbit immunoglobulin G (IgG) ate was clarified by centrifugation at 3,900 x g at 4°C for 30 min. cell lysate was then incubated with strep-tactin sepharose resin (QIAGEN) at 4°C. protein complexes associated with the resin were eluted into 2 ml of PD lysis buffer containing 2.5 mM of desthiobiotin. MudPIT analysis An analytical reversed-phase liquid chromatography column was generated by pulling a 100-m (interior diameter (ID) of 360 m) OD capillary tube (Polymicro Technologies, Phoenix, AZ) to 5-m ID tip. LC-MS/MS analysis was performed with an Agilent high-pressure LC pump (Agilent) peptide identification were performed with Integrated Proteomics Pipeline—IP2. DTASelect parameters were—p 2 -y 1—trypstat—pfp.01 –extra-pI-DB-dm-in. the tandem mass spectra were searched against a human protein database. cells were lysed with 12 ml of PD lysis buffer (+) and 5 g/ml of deoxyribonuclease I. cell lysate was clarified by centrifugation at 3,900 x g at 4°C for 30 min. protein complexes associated with the resin were eluted into 2 ml of PD lysis buffer. strong cation exchange particles (SCX Luna, 5-m diameter, 125 pores, Phenomenex, Torrance, CA) were packed in-house from particle slurries in methanol to 2.5 cm. Reversed phase particles (2 cm, C18 Aqua, 3-m diameter, 125 pores, Phenomenex) were then successively packed onto the capillary tube using the same method as SCX loading. MudPIT experiments (10-step) were performed in which each step corresponds to 0, 10, 20, 40, 50, 60, 70, 80, 90, and 100% buffer C (500 mM of ammonium acetate, 0.1% formic acid, and 5% acetonitrile) data analysis Protein and peptide identification were performed with Integrated Proteomics Pipeline—IP2 (Integrated Proteomics Applications, San Diego, CA) siRNA target host-cell proteins were selected based on availability of validated siRNA sequences. at 72 h post-transfection, cells were infected (MOI = 0.05) with rLCMV/ZsG. siRNA target host-cell proteins were selected based on with primary mouse anti ATP1A1 or PHB antibody followed by secondary anti-mouse IgG antibody conjugated with Alexa Fluore 568. each pixel was assigned a value of 1. co-localization coefficients (CC) were determined by dividing the sum of green-and red-positive pixels by the sum of green positive pixels. comparison of non-weighted and weighted CC allowed us to determine whether brighter pixels were present in the co-localized regions. eGFP levels in clarified cell lysates adjusted to same total protein concentration with cell lysis buffer were measured by a fluorescent plate reader. plasmid pC-LCMV-Z-Strep or pC-LASV-Z-FLAG. at 5 h post-transfection, media were replaced with fresh media and incubated at 37°C and 5% CO2 for 19 h. cells were cultured in fresh medium containing ouabain (30 or 40 nM) or rocaglamide (50 or 100 nM) 293T cells seeded (4.0 x 105 cells/well) were infected with scrLCMV/ZsG-P2A-NP for 2 h. at 24 h pi, cells were three times washed with fresh media. at 48 h pi, cells were three times washed with fresh media to eliminate infectious virus particle produced in the absence of compound treatment. at 48 h pi, cells were fixed, permeabilized by treatment with DB.
